overview:
Simon is a dog trainer and behaviour consultant working in Shropshire UK.

His ethos is science based having an emphasis on behaviour science and learning theory and he has been working with dogs full time for five years.

He’s enrolled in the Academy for Dog Trainers, founded by leading behaviourist, academic and author, Jean Donaldson and is a member of the Behaviour Education Network. He regularly networks with fellow professionals in the UK and US to share experiences and keep his knowledge bang up-to-date as well as regularly blogging on dog training issues.

He has a particular interest in working with rescue dogs and dogs with fear and aggression problems, stemming from his own experience with a deeply troubled rescue Rottweiler, Thomson.

Simon’s career was originally as a sound engineer, but he gave it up as it involved pitifully few dogs. He now shares his life with rescue Rottie Murphy, spaniel Woody and two cats – Oscar and Frankie.
